title: Don Quixote
author: Miguel de Cervantes
description: Often considered the first modern novel, it follows the adventures of a delusional knight and his loyal squire.

title: The Road
author: Cormac McCarthy
description: A post-apocalyptic tale of a father and son's harrowing journey through a devastated world, exploring themes of survival and hope.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A philosophical and inspirational tale about a shepherd named Santiago on a journey to discover his personal legend.

title: The Da Vinci Code
author: Dan Brown
description: A gripping thriller that blends art, history, and religion as Harvard symbologist Robert Langdon unravels a mystery hidden within famous artworks.

title: The Road Less Traveled
author: M.Scott Peck
description: A self-help classic that explores the path to personal growth, emotional well-being, and spiritual fulfillment.

title: Moby Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: An epic adventure and philosophical exploration of obsession, as Captain Ahab pursues the elusive white whale.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A dystopian vision of a future society where citizens are controlled through technology, pleasure, and conformity.

title: The Maid
author: Nita Prose
description: A classic locked-room mystery concerning wealthy dead people and hotel sanitation protocol.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: This novel delves into the tortured mind of Raskolnikov, a young student who commits a murder and grapples with guilt and justice.

title: The Sun Also Rises
author: Ernest Hemingway
description: Hemingway's novel captures the disillusionment and aimlessness of the post-World War I generation in Europe.
